description: The CodeBoarding tooling subsystem is designed around a Factory-Manager pattern, where the Tooling Orchestrator (CodeBoardingToolkit) centralizes the instantiation and lifecycle of all repository-aware tools. The subsystem separates concerns between execution analysis (CFGs and call paths), structural analysis (inheritance and packages), and context resolution (source code reading). All these functional tools rely on the Graph Modeling Engine as their foundational data provider, which stores the results of static analysis in unified structures like CallGraph and StaticAnalysisResults. This separation ensures that while tools operate independently to serve agent requests, they maintain a consistent view of the codebase through shared repository context and normalized graph nodes.

components.name: Tooling Orchestrator
components.description: Manages the lifecycle and dependency injection for all repository-aware tools. It instantiates specific tools (e.g., `read_source_reference`, `read_cfg`) and provides them with a shared `RepoContext` containing static analysis results and filesystem managers.

components.name: Graph Modeling Engine
components.description: Implements the core data structures for control flow analysis and structural metadata. It maintains the `CallGraph` of method-to-method invocations and the `StaticAnalysisResults` which include class inheritance trees and package dependency maps.

components.name: Execution Path Analyzer
components.description: Provides high-level tools for agents to navigate the project's execution flow. It queries the call graph to retrieve complete control flow graphs (CFG) or specific method call sequences.

components.name: Structural Hierarchy Analyzer
components.description: Enables agents to inspect class hierarchies and package relationships. It extracts inheritance patterns (super/subclasses) and module-level imports from the static analysis core.

components.name: Source Context Resolver
components.description: Bridges the gap between abstract symbol names and physical source code. It resolves qualified names to file coordinates and extracts targeted code snippets for LLM ingestion.

components.name: Unclassified
components.description: Component for all unclassified files and utility functions (Utility functions/External Libraries/Dependencies)
